intro: Colanthelia sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparsely-flowered colanthelia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms. It is characterized by its slender, unbranched stems and pinnately compound leaves with elongated, narrow leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences bearing both male and female flowers, typical of many palm species. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
